definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: She married and divorced twice, stripping both husbands of their cash.
sentences.chinese: 她曾經結婚兩次，把兩任丈夫的錢全部洗劫了。

sentences.english: Thief rifled every drawer in the room.
sentences.chinese: 竊賊洗劫了房內所有抽屜裏的東西。
皇家軍隊於1527年洗劫了羅馬城。

sentences.english: They didn't find him, but they ransacked the church.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有找到他，但是他們洗劫了教堂。
野蠻人把西部一座座城鎮洗劫一空。

sentences.english: After the thief broke in, there was almost nothing left in the room.
sentences.chinese: 小偷破門而入，屋裏幾乎被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: Many innocent blacks were slain and their homes sacked.
sentences.chinese: 許多無辜的黑人慘遭殺害，他們的家也被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: Nanjing city was sacked by Japanese aggressors.
sentences.chinese: 南京曾遭受過日本侵略者的洗劫。

sentences.english: Enemy soldiers ransacked the city and carried off its treasures.
sentences.chinese: 敵兵洗劫了這座城市，掠走了城中的財寶。

sentences.english: The Emerald Buddha was carried off with the spoils.
sentences.chinese: 翡翠玉佛和其他戰利品被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: His house in Berlin was ransacked by the Nazis.
sentences.chinese: 他在柏林的住宅曾遭納粹黨人洗劫。

sentences.english: They ransacked the old lady's house in the dead of night.
sentences.chinese: 他們在夜晚萬籟俱寂時洗劫了這位老婦的住宅。

sentences.english: The demonstrators also damaged cars and vandalized other shops.
sentences.chinese: 示威者還毀壞汽車，洗劫其它商店。

sentences.english: Several shops looked like they had been looted.
sentences.chinese: 零星的幾家商店看上去像被洗劫過。

definition: to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to set on fire/to commit arson
